The SMART Retrieval System Experiments in Automatic Document Processing .A Salton, G. The automatic SMART document retrieval system was designed at Harvard University between 1961 and 1964, and has been operating of IBM 7094 and 360 equipment both at Harvard and at Cornell University for several years.  The system takes documents and search requests in the natural language, performs a fully automatic content analysis of the texts using one of several dozen programmed language analysis methods, matches analyzed documents with analyzed search requests, and retrieves for the user's attention those stored items believed to be most similar to the submitted queries. .X 30	1	1327 34	1	1327
